text: Thea Lim is a Singaporean Canadian writer,"Thea Lim wanted to write about grief — and ended up with a time travelling love story". CBC Books, July 12, 2018. whose debut novel An Ocean of Minutes was named as a shortlisted finalist for the 2018 Scotiabank Giller Prize."Esi Edugyan, Patrick deWitt among finalists for $100,000 Giller Prize". Toronto Star, October 1, 2018. Born in Canada and raised mostly in Singapore, Lim has an MFA in Creative Writing from the University of Houston."Thea Lim's book An Ocean of Minutes, draws on the best of old and new CanLit". Toronto Star, June 29, 2018. She published the novella The Same Woman in 2007, and An Ocean of Minutes followed in 2018."An Ocean of Minutes by Thea Lim review: a timely debut novel". The Irish Times, September 17, 2018. She taught in the University of Toronto's Writing and Rhetoric Program, before joining the faculty of Sheridan College's Creative Writing & Publishing program. ==Bibliography== *The Same Woman (2007) *An Ocean of Minutes (2018) ==References== Category:21st-century Canadian novelists Category:21st-century Canadian women writers Category:21st-century Singaporean women writers Category:Canadian women novelists Category:Singaporean novelists Category:Singaporean emigrants to Canada Category:University of Houston alumni Category:Writers from Toronto Category:Living people Category:Canadian writers of Asian descent Category:1981 births
